author: Michael Larabel
description: Well, this is a pleasant surprise... Less than 24 hours after the AMD Computex 2025 keynote where better/more-timely ROCm support for client GPUs was brought up, AMD ROCm 6.4.1 is now officially released. With ROCm 6.4.1 there is formal support for RDNA4 GPUs, including the Radeon RX 9000 series consumer graphics cards...
title: AMD Releases ROCm 6.4.1 With RDNA4 GPU Support

author: Michael Larabel
description: The libinput input handling library that's used by both X11 and Wayland based environments on the Linux desktop is preparing to introduce a Lua-based plug-in system. Via Lua scripts it will be possible to modify evdev input events / input device behavior to deal with quirky/broken input devices and better workaround other problems that aren't currently easily addressable...
title: libinput Preparing To Introduce A Lua-Based Plugin System For Modifying Devices/Events

author: Michael Larabel
description: Fwupd 2.0.10 is out today as the newest feature update to this open-source firmware updating solution built around the Linux Vendor Firmware Service (LVFS)...
title: Fwupd 2.0.10 Brings Support For New Logitech & Lenovo Devices

author: Michael Larabel
description: At the AMD Computex keynote last night in addition to announcing the Ryzen Threadripper 9000 series, Radeon RX 9060 XT, and Ryzen AI PRO R9700, they also brief talked about the ROCm compute stack and their plans for the second half of 2025...
title: AMD To Focus On Better ROCm Linux Experience In H2-2025, Day-One Client Support

author: Michael Larabel
description: Last year NVIDIA began publicly outlining known Wayland limitations for their driver and future support plans. This week NVIDIA put out updated information concerning known gaps in Wayland support as well as their ongoing future driver plans for enhancing the feature compatibility under this X11 successor...
title: NVIDIA Outlines Current Wayland Limitations & Future Driver Plans

author: Michael Larabel
description: The FreeBSD project today published their status report outlining their development happenings during Q1'2025. There's been a lot going on in the FreeBSD world, especially for improving laptop support and other modern hardware coverage for this BSD operating system...
title: FreeBSD Continues Improving Hardware Support For Framework Laptops, WiFi Devices

author: Michael Larabel
description: Released yesterday was the newest monthly feature update to the Intel Compute Runtime as their open-source GPU compute stack for OpenCL and oneAPI Level Zero support on Intel integrated and discrete graphics processors...
title: Intel Compute Runtime 25.18.33578.6 Brings ULLS For Lunar Lake

author: Michael Larabel
description: Merged yesterday to the GNOME Display Manager "GDM" codebase is disabling of the X11/X.Org session by default as the first step toward deprecating GNOME's X11 session support...
title: GNOME GDM Now Disables The X11/X.Org Session By Default

author: Michael Larabel
description: Sent out last week was one final batch of drm-misc-next updates ahead of the upcoming Linux 6.16 kernel cycle. Besides a couple fixes, most notable was new async flipping code for the Intel DRM driver with the IN_FORMATS_ASYNC DRM property...
title: DRM IN_FORMATS_ASYNC Coming For The Intel Driver With Linux 6.16

author: Michael Larabel
description: Ongoing Wayland release manager Simon Ser has proposed doing away with alpha and beta releases moving forward as a sign of Wayland's maturity and to ease the release management process...
title: Wayland Looks To Do Away With Alpha & Beta Releases

author: Michael Larabel
description: Following the Mesa 25.1 stable release from earlier this month, Mesa 25.1.1 is now available as the first point release bringing an assortment of different OpenGL and Vulkan driver fixes...
title: Mesa 25.1.1 Released With Radeon Workarounds For DOOM: The Dark Ages
